item.content:
Envy

Envy is a linter for .env files written in Go. It aims to be fast, accurate, and easy to use. It runs on Linux and macOS.

Envy can help lint single .env files, lint entire directories of .env files, or be integrated into CI to lint build and deployment stage .env files.

Envy was inspired by the Rust .env linter dotenv-linter, with the aim to provide similar functionality, but from a tool written in Go.

Envy checks .env files for things like:

  • duplicate keys
  • unordered keys
  • malformed keys
  • malformed values
  • incorrect casing
  • incorrect spacing
  • incorrect quoting

Read more about usage and checks, or check out the source

item.content:
Envy checks for the following .env file best practices and required items.

Checks

  1. Duplicate key
  2. Invalid delimiter in key
  3. Key without value
  4. Key is not sorted
  5. Key has an invalid first character (prefix)
  6. Key is not valid
  7. Value has unnecessary quotes
  8. Extra spacing around separator
  9. Value uses substitution without proper quoting
  10. Value has leading or trailing whitespace
  11. Value contains whitespace without proper quoting
  12. Last line is blank
  13. Multiple successive blank lines
  14. Value is missing proper quoting
  15. Line does not have a valid separator

c1. Duplicate Key

Checks that the key is not repeated.

  • ✅ KEY1=value1
  • ❌ KEY1=value2
  • ❌ KEY1=value3

c2. Invalid delimiter in key

Checks that only underscores are used to separate words in the key.

  • ✅ KEY_1=value1
  • ❌ KEY-1=value1

c3. Key without value

Checks that the key has a value. A valid value must be a non-empty string.

  • ✅ KEY=value
  • ❌ KEY=

c4. Key is not sorted

Checks that keys art sorted lexicographically.

  • ✅ KEYB=value2
  • ✅ KEYC=value3
  • ✅ KEYD=value4
  • ❌ KEYA=value1

c5. Key has an invalid first character

Checks that the first character of the key is valid. A valid key prefix must be a capital letter or a number.

  • ✅ MY_KEY=value
  • ❌ mY_KEY=value

c6. Valid Key

Checks that the key is valid. A valid key should consist of only capital letters, numbers, and underscores.

  • ✅ MY_KEY1=value1
  • ❌ my-key-1=value1

c7. Unnecessary quotes

Checks that the value isn’t quoted unnecessarily.

  • ✅ KEY="quote this"
  • ❌ KEY="noquotes"

c8. Extra spacing around separator

Checks that there are no spaces around the separator.

  • ✅ KEY=value
  • ❌ KEY = value
  • ❌ KEY= value
  • ❌ KEY =value

c9. Substitution without proper quoting

Checks that the value uses proper quoting around substitutions.

  • ✅ KEY="some ${FOO} value"
  • ❌ KEY=some $FOO value

c10. Leading or trailing whitespace

Checks that the value does’t have leading or trailing whitespace

  • ✅ KEY=value
  • ❌ KEY= value
  • ❌ KEY= value 
  • ❌ KEY=value 

c11. Whitespace without proper quoting

Checks that the value doesn’t contain whitespace without proper quoting

  • ✅ KEY="value with spaces"
  • ❌ KEY=value with spaces
  • ❌ KEY=value with new\nlines

c12. No empty last line

Checks that the last line of an .env file is not empty.

  • ✅

    KEY1=value1
KEY2=value2

  • ❌

    KEY1=value1
KEY2=value2
 

c13. Multiple successive blank lines

Checks that blank lines are not repeated.

  • ✅

    KEY1=value1

KEY2=value2

  • ❌

    KEY1=value1


KEY2=value2 

c14. Value is missing proper quoting

Checks that values containing an equals sign are properly quoted.

  • ✅ KEY="setting=true"
  • ❌ KEY=setting=true

c15. Line does not have a valid separator

Checks that the line contains an equals sign separator.

  • ✅ KEY=value
  • ❌ KEY:value

item.content:
How to install and use envy.

Setup

Install envy.

go get github.com/envy-lint/envy

Usage

You can run envy several ways.

Default

By default, envy will look for a .env file in the current directory.

envy

Specify file

Specify a file with the -f flag.

envy -f sample.env

Stdin

Pipe output to envy.

echo sample.env | envy
